name: Nooni

sentences: wvù lě
wvù + lé
kwɔ᷆ːn lě
kwɔ᷆ːn+ lé
bɔ́ lé
bɔ́ + lé
mutù fǐ
mutù + fí
dìɛ̀msɛ̌n fí
dìɛ̀msɛ̌n + fí
dìɛ̀msɛ̌n lé
dìɛ̀msɛ̌n + lé
wɔ̀ + fǐ
wɔ̀ + fí
dìɛ̀msɛ̌n nɔ̂ː yɛ᷅n cɔ̌ŋ é
The man saw the thief
cɔ̌ŋ nɔ̂ː yo᷅ kwɔ᷆ːn
The thief killed the woman
dìɛ̀msɛ̌n nɔ̂ː nca᷅w mutù
The man chose the car
cɔ̌ŋ nɔ̂ː bɔ᷅ŋ ŋwà
The thief found the book
kwɔ᷆ːn nɔ̂ː cɔ᷅ŋ kèŋkfǔ fɔ̀wǎy
The woman stole the yam at the market
dìɛ̀msɛ̌n nɔ̂ː nca᷅w ŋwà
The man chose the book
cɔ̌ŋ nɔ̂ː bɔ᷅ŋ kwɔ᷆ːn
The thief found the woman
me n-cí nɔ̂ː n-tɔ᷅ fɔ̀wǎy fɔgò
Yesterday, I came to the market.
wɔ̀ cǐ nɔ̂ː bɔ᷅ŋ kèŋkfǔ kefwé
The day before yesterday, you found the yam.
bèsèn bɛ̂ː fi᷅ dìɛ̀msɛ̌n ɛ̀bɛ̀n
Today, we helped the man.
me m-bɛ̂ː n-yɛ᷅n cɔ̌ŋ é ɛ̀bɛ̀n
Today, I saw the thief.
bɔ́ nɔ̂ː yo᷅ cɔ̌ŋ
They killed the thief just now.
wvù tɔ̀ nɔ̂ː yo᷅w mutù
He heard the car a long time ago.
me n-tɔ̀ nɔ̂ n-yɛ᷅n mutù ě
I saw the car a long time ago.
wvù nǔ yów mutù
He is about to hear the car.
me nú n-géː n-yó cɔ̌ŋ ɛ̀bɛ̀n
Today, I will kill the theif.
me nú m-bóy n-fí kwɔ᷆ːn ntfǔː
Tomorrow, I will help the woman.
dìɛ̀msɛ̌n nú bóy tɔ́ fɔ̀wǎy fɔ̀ shě ntfǔː
The day after tomorrow, the man will come to the market.
cɔ̌ŋ nǔ yúː bɔ́ŋ ŋwà
The thief will find the book a long time in the future.
wɔ̀ cǐ nɔ̂ː fi᷅ dìɛ̀msɛ̌n fɔgò
You helped the man yesterday.
dìɛ̀msɛ̌n nú bóy bɔ́ŋ cɔ̌ŋ ntfǔː
The man will find the thief tomorrow
fɔgò cǐ nú Bvukema
Yesterday was Bvukema
kefwé cǐ nú Bvúzhí
The day before yesterday was Bvúzhí
ntfǔː nú bvûŋka᷆ːden
Tomorrow is Bvuŋkaden
fɔ̀ shě ntfǔː nú bvúzhı᷇ːde᷆n.
The day after tomorrow is Bvuzhiden
fɔgò cǐ nú bvúzhí
Yesterday was Bvúzhí
ntfǔː nú bvúmbòn
Tomorrow is Bvumbon
fɔgò cǐ nú bvúmbòn.
Yesterday was Bvumbon.
me ncí nɔ̂ː ntɔ᷅ fɔ̀wǎy bvúmbòn.
On Bvumbon, I came to the market.
wɔ̀ nǔ yúː cɔ́ŋ kèŋkfǔ bvúsɔ̀w.
On Bvusɔw, you will steal the yam.
kwɔ᷆ːn nǔ bóy fí me bvúzhí.
On Bvuzhi, the woman will help me.
wvù tɔ̀ nɔ̂ː bɔ᷅ŋ ŋwà bvûŋka᷆ː.
On bvûŋka᷆ː, he found the book
fɔ̀ shě ntfǔː nú bvútfu᷅.
The day after tomorrow is Bvutfu.
me nú mbóy ncáw mutù bvútfu᷅.
On Bvutfu, I will choose the car.
wvù bɛ̂ː yo᷅ kwɔ᷆ːn ɛ̀bɛ̀n.
Today, he killed the woman.
wɔ̀ tɔ̀ nɔ̂ː yo᷅w cɔ̌ŋ.
You heard the thief a long time ago.
ntfǔː nú bvûŋka᷆ːde᷆n.
Tomorrow is Bvuŋkaden.
cɔ̌ŋ nú bóy bɔ́ŋ bèsèn bvûŋka᷆ːde᷆n.
On Bvuŋkaden, the thief will find us.
me mbɛ̂ː nca᷅w ŋwà ɛ̀bɛ̀n.
Today, I chose the book.
dìɛ̀msɛ̌n nú yɛ́n wvù lě.
The man is about to see him.
kefwé cí nú bvûŋka᷆ː.
The day before yesterday was bvûŋka᷆ː
me nú nfí dìɛ̀msɛ̌n.
I am about to help the man.
kwɔ᷆ːn cǐ nɔ̂ː yɛ᷅n wáy é bvútfu᷅.
On Bvutfu, the woman saw the market.
bèsèn nǔ géː cɔ́ŋ mutù ɛ̀bɛ̀n.
Today, we will steal the car.
bɔ́ nɔ̂ː yɛ᷅n me lé fɔ̀wǎy.
They saw me at the market just now.
bvúsɔ̀w nǔ fɔ̀ shě ntfǔː. (Today is Bvuŋkaden)
Bvusɔw is the day after tomorrow.
me nú ŋgéː nyɛ́n kèŋkfǔ lé ɛ̀bɛ̀n. (Today is Bvuŋkaden)
Today, I will see the yam.
wvù tɔ̀ nɔ̂ː yɛ᷅n bèsèn ě bvúmbòn. (Today is Bvuŋkaden)
On Bvumbon, he saw us.
bèsèn nǔ bóy tɔ́ fɔ̀wǎy bvúzhı᷇ːde᷆n. (Today is Bvuŋkaden)
On Bvuzhiden, we will come to the market.
me ncí nɔ̂ː nfı᷅ dìɛ̀msɛ̌n bvúsɔ̀w.
On Bvusɔw, I helped the man. (Today is Bvumbon)
cɔ̌ŋ nɔ̂ː cɔ᷅ŋ kèŋkfǔ.
The thief stole the yam just now. (Today is Bvumbon)
me nú nyúː nyów mutù bvûŋka᷆ːde᷆n.
On Bvuŋkaden, I will hear the car. (Today is Bvumbon)
kwɔ᷆ːn nǔ géː yó dìɛ̀msɛ̌n ɛ̀bɛ̀n.
Today, the woman will kill the man. (Today is Bvumbon)
dìɛ̀msɛ̌n bɛ̂ː yɛ᷅n wɔ̀ lě ɛ̀bɛ̀n.
Today, the man saw you. (Today is Bvumbon)

note: The langauage belongs to the Beboid group of the Atlantic-Congo family. It is spoken by approx. 40,000 people in Cameroon. ɛ and ɔ are vowels. ŋ, sh, y and zh are consonants. The mark ː indicates that the vowel is long. The superscript marks denote tones: –́ high, –̂ falling (high ↘ low), –᷆ falling (middle↘ low), –̀ low, –᷅ rising (low ↗ middle), –̌ rising (low ↗ high); if none are present, the syllable has middle tone. Yam is the edible tuber of the tropical plant of the same name. A week in this langauge is eight days; Bvutfu, Bvuŋka, Bvuzhi, Bvukema, Bvuŋkaden, Bvuzhiden, Bvusɔw, Bvumbon.
